name: RIFT.ware™ NS Descriptors Catalog
description: RIFT.ware™, an open source NFV development and deployment software platform that makes it simple to create, deploy and manage hyper-scale Virtual network functions and applications.

descriptors.description: VPNaaS Provider NSD for Corporation X

vnf-configuration.config-template:
#!/usr/bin/expect -f
set login "root"
set addr <rw_mgmt_ip>
set pw "6windos"
spawn ssh -1 $login@$addr

set timeout 60

expect "yes/no" {
    send "yes\r"
    expect "*?assword:" { send "$pw\r" }
    } "*?assword:" { send "$pw\r" }

expect "# "
send "cli\r"
expect "{}"
send "edit conf running\r"
expect "ing}"

# Setup eth1 config
send "eth1\r"
expect "eth1}"
send "ipaddress dhcpv4\r"
expect "dhcpv4}"
send "dhcp enable\r"
expect "dhcpv4}"
send "exit\r"
expect "eth1}"
send "exit\r"
expect "ing}"

# Setup eth2 config
send "eth2\r"
expect "eth2}"
send "ipaddress dhcpv4\r"
expect "dhcpv4}"
send "dhcp enable\r"
expect "dhcpv4}"
send "exit\r"
expect "eth2}"
send "exit\r"
expect "ing}"

#Setup loopback
send "loopback0\r"
expect "back0}"
send "ipaddress 2.2.2.2/32\r"
expect "back0}"
send "exit\r"
expect "ing}"

#Setup VRF 2
send "vrf2\r"
expect "vrf2}"
send "forwarding ipv4 enable\r"
expect "vrf2}"
send "exit\r"
expect "ing}"

#Applyconfig
send "addrunning\r"
expect "ing}"
send "exit\r"
expect "{}"

# Get MAC of eth2
send "show interface eth2\r"
expect -re {ether (\S+)}
set macaddr $expect_out(1,string)
puts $macaddr

# Enter into edit config mode again
send "edit conf running\r"

#Setup route for GRE tunnel
send "rtg\r"
expect "rtg}"
send "route 3.3.3.3/32 100.0.108.60\r"
expect "rtg}"
send "exit\r"
expect "ing}"

#Setup VLAN on eth2 and vrf2
send "vlan2\r"
expect "vlan2}"
send "bind eth2 id 200\r"
expect "vlan2}"
send "mac-address $macaddr\r"
expect "vlan2}"
send "ipaddress 200.1.1.2/24\r"
expect "vlan2}"
send "vrf-id 2\r"
expect "vlan2}"
send "interface up\r"
expect "vlan2}"
send "exit\r"
expect "ing}"

#Setup GRE on vrf2
send "gre2\r"
expect "gre2}"
send "bind 2.2.2.2 3.3.3.3 \r"
expect "gre2}"
send "endpoints 5.1.1.1 5.1.1.2\r"
expect "gre2}"
send "vrf-id 2\r"
expect "gre2}"
send "checksum-input disable\r"
expect "gre2}"
send "interface up\r"
expect "gre2}"
send "exit\r"
expect "ing}"

#Setup routing in VRF2 for VLAN2 traffic
send "rtg\r"
expect "rtg}"
send "route 50.1.1.1/32 5.1.1.2 vrf-id 2\r"
expect "rtg}"
send "exit\r"
expect "ing}"

#Applyconfig
send "addrunning\r"
expect "ing}"
send "exit\r"
expect "{}"

descriptors.name: Vpn_Provider_Site_CorpA_nsd

#!/usr/bin/expect -f
set login "root"
set addr <rw_mgmt_ip>
set pw "6windos"
spawn ssh -1 $login@$addr

set timeout 60

expect "yes/no" {
    send "yes\r"
    expect "*?assword:" { send "$pw\r" }
    } "*?assword:" { send "$pw\r" }

expect "# "
send "cli\r"
expect "{}"
send "edit conf running\r"
expect "ing}"

# Setup eth1 config
send "eth1\r"
expect "eth1}"
send "ipaddress dhcpv4\r"
expect "dhcpv4}"
send "dhcp enable\r"
expect "dhcpv4}"
send "exit\r"
expect "eth1}"
send "exit\r"
expect "ing}"

# Setup eth2 config
send "eth2\r"
expect "eth2}"
send "ipaddress dhcpv4\r"
expect "dhcpv4}"
send "dhcp enable\r"

send "exit\r"
expect "ing}"

#Setup loopback
send "loopback0\r"
expect "back0}"
send "ipaddress 2.2.2.2/32\r"
expect "back0}"
send "exit\r"
expect "ing}"

#Setup VRF 2
send "vrf2\r"
expect "vrf2}"
send "forwarding ipv4 enable\r"
expect "vrf2}"
send "exit\r"
expect "ing}"

#Applyconfig
send "addrunning\r"
expect "ing}"
send "exit\r"
expect "{}"

# Get MAC of eth2
send "show interface eth2\r"
expect -re {ether (\S+)}
set macaddr $expect_out(1,string)
puts $macaddr

# Enter into edit config mode again
send "edit conf running\r"

#Setup route for GRE tunnel
send "rtg\r"
expect "rtg}"
send "route 3.3.3.3/32 100.0.108.60\r"

send "exit\r"
expect "ing}"

#Setup VLAN on eth2 and vrf2
send "vlan2\r"
expect "vlan2}"
send "bind eth2 id 200\r"
expect "vlan2}"
send "mac-address $macaddr\r"
expect "vlan2}"
send "ipaddress 200.1.1.2/24\r"
expect "vlan2}"
send "vrf-id 2\r"
expect "vlan2}"
send "interface up\r"
expect "vlan2}"
send "exit\r"
expect "ing}"

#Setup GRE on vrf2
send "gre2\r"
expect "gre2}"
send "bind 2.2.2.2 3.3.3.3 \r"
expect "gre2}"
send "endpoints 5.1.1.1 5.1.1.2\r"
expect "gre2}"
send "vrf-id 2\r"
expect "gre2}"
send "checksum-input disable\r"
expect "gre2}"
send "interface up\r"
expect "gre2}"
send "exit\r"
expect "ing}"

#Setup routing in VRF2 for VLAN2 traffic
send "rtg\r"
expect "rtg}"
send "route 50.1.1.1/32 5.1.1.2 vrf-id 2\r"

#Applyconfig

send "exit\r"

descriptors.name: Vpn_Provider_Site_CorpB_nsd

vnf-configuration.config-template:
#!/usr/bin/expect -f
set login "vyatta"
set addr <rw_mgmt_ip>
set pw "vyatta"
spawn ssh $login@$addr

set timeout 60

expect "yes/no" {
    send "yes
"
    expect "*?assword:" { send "$pw
" }
    } "*?assword:" { send "$pw
" }

expect "$ "
send "configure
"
expect "# "
send "set protocols static interface-route 50.1.1.0/24 next-hop-interface dp0s6
"
expect "# "
send "set protocols static route 2.2.2.2/32 next-hop 100.0.108.5
"
expect "# "
send "set interfaces loopback lo1 address 3.3.3.3/32
"
expect "# "
send "set interfaces tunnel tun0 address 5.1.1.2/24
"
expect "# "
send "set interfaces tunnel tun0 encapsulation gre
"
expect "# "
send "set interfaces tunnel tun0 local-ip 3.3.3.3
"
expect "# "
send "set interfaces tunnel tun0 remote-ip 2.2.2.2
"
expect "# "
send "set protocols static route 200.1.1.1/32 next-hop 5.1.1.1
"
expect "# "
send "commit
"
expect "# "
send "exit 
"
expect "$ "

name: RIFT.ware™ VNF Descriptors Catalog
description: RIFT.ware™, an open source NFV development and deployment software platform that makes it simple to create, deploy and manage hyper-scale Virtual network functions and applications.

descriptors.description: This is a Benu ClientSim VNF

vdu.name: master
vdu.cloud-init:
#cloud-config
password: fedora
chpasswd: { expire: False }
ssh_pwauth: True
runcmd:
  - [ systemctl, daemon-reload ]
  - [ systemctl, start, --no-block, ngnix.service ]
  - [ systemctl, start, --no-block, php-fpm.service ]

descriptors.name: vrouter_vnfd

descriptors.description: This is a Benu VSE-SI VNF

vdu.name: RW.VM.MASTER
vdu.cloud-init:
#cloud-config
password: fedora
chpasswd: { expire: False }
ssh_pwauth: True
write_files:
  - path: /opt/rift/.vnf_start_conf
    content: |
        VNFNAME="vsesi"
        VDUNAME={{ vdu.name }}
        MASTERIP= 
runcmd: 
  - [ systemctl, daemon-reload ]
  - [ systemctl, enable, multivmvnf.service ]
  - [ systemctl, start, --no-block, multivmvnf.service ]

vdu.name: RW.VM.FASTPATH.LEAD
vdu.cloud-init:
#cloud-config
password: fedora
chpasswd: { expire: False }                                                                                                                 
ssh_pwauth: True
write_files:
  - path: /opt/rift/.vnf_start_conf
    content: |
        VNFNAME="vsesi"
        VDUNAME={{ vdu.name }}
        MASTERIP= {{ vdu[c1bb1a92-aa48-4908-89b2-5a78ff324953].mgmt.ip }}
runcmd:
  - [ systemctl, daemon-reload ]
  - [ systemctl, enable, multivmvnf.service ]
  - [ systemctl, start, --no-block, multivmvnf.service ]
  - [ systemctl, enable, benuvnf.service ]
  - [ systemctl, start, --no-block, benuvnf.service ]

descriptors.name: vsesi_vnfd

descriptors.description: This is a Clearwater IMS VNF
descriptors.name: cwims_vnfd
